website_summaries.verdict: New Balance kept the MC 1006 sleek and clean, which got the interest of players searching for supportive and stable court shoes. Its innovative midsole minimizes impact, making it one of the most comfortable New Balance tennis trainers in the market.Aside from being light on the pocket, this all-court footgear doesn’t weigh the foot down with its durable composition. And while it allows the users to spring from one point to another with confidence, this doesn’t keep the foot toasty even during long matches.
pros: A good chunk of New Balance 1006 reviewers state that this shoe needs no break-in period
Scores of satisfied buyers vouch that there’s adequate support even during long matches
Lots of users agree that this footgear is very comfortable
Many reviews indicate that this is one of the most lightweight shoes by New Balance
It provides ample traction according to plenty of consumers who appreciate its outsole composition
A couple of wearers consider this shoe breathable
A few wearers find it less bulky than the Adidas Barricades
cons: Some users suggested replacing the removable sockliner with customized orthotics for a more comfy fit
As declared by some buyers, this footgear comes with a too sturdy base that bending it is causing foot discomforts

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!  New Balance, please bring back WC1005 model.
customer_reviews.text: Shoe soles are quite inflexible. There is no interior cushioning either. All this makes for extremely uncomfortable tennis. My size is 9.5 2A (narrow) WC1006WS, and have been wearing the WC1005 model (which I assumed the 1006 was a replacement for) for over a decade. I play 3 times per week. New Balance has changed the design, unfortunately. Even after inserting a cushioning insole, the cement court surface felt uncomfortably hard and I could not flex my feet when running, causing my feet and leg muscles to hurt. I hope New Balance brings back the old design. These shoes also run smaller than the WC1005. I returned them for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B.

customer_reviews.title: Nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great stable hard court shoe. Was looking for more cushion and this shoe definitely provides that. Hoping these are durable enough for regular play. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Very glad I purchased these New Balance shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I am not a big fan of purchasing shoes online. However, I’m so glad I decided to try these New Balance Tennis court shoes. I know New Balance is a great brand but I’ve never purchased court shoes before. I’m a super new tennis player..2.5. These are very sturdy yet comfortable shoes....even with my orthotics. I’m very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: 5 in a quality shoe and this fit more like less than a 6
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not sized correctly. I brought them on a cruise so I was "stuck". They were so tight that I could not wear them. I tried for about an hour to see if the leather would stretch at all but they are clearly not sized properly. I always wear a 6.5 in a quality shoe and this fit more like less than a 6.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Mesch

customer_reviews.title: Greatest court shoe I’ve ever worn!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes. Bought my first pair last March in Naples Florida. I live on pickleball courts. Most comfortable court shoes I’ve EVER worn. I now have four pair of them. I’m prepared for when they discontinue this model.
customer_reviews.author: Momma B

customer_reviews.title: Toe too narrow
customer_reviews.text: I have bought New Balance for many years because I need a Narrow court shoe. Bring back the 1005! These 1006 are too narrow in the toe, and too stiff. I returned the 8 1/2,N , bought 9N and returned, bought 81/2 N again tried around the house and returning them. Am very disappointed in New Balance now.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for the tennis court
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes, especially the hard soles, but comfortable fit. I usually go right through the toes and bottoms of my tennis shoes when I play almost every day in the summer, but these are lasting a little longer. Don't forget to use the very top hole when you are lacing them, because it will help prevent slippage from side-to-side. I forgot, and almost wanted to send them back! Once I realized it, I laced them correctly and they are great!
customer_reviews.author: R.D.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: I have many different New Balance Tennis Shoes. I like most all of them as they lay on the courts a little longer & fit a wide foot. These ones were more narrow fitting in the toe area. They work but not as comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Reto Gross

customer_reviews.title: Narrow enough for my foot!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find a court shoe with a narrow heal. This one fits great, although not as stylish as I would like!
customer_reviews.author: janet

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always bought the 1006 court shoes... in white. The black ones were $25 cheaper, so I bought them instead this time. I received soooo many compliments on them and they are super comfortable and supportive.
customer_reviews.author: Trying to be healthy mom

customer_reviews.title: Comphy shoe
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is very comfortable. Gets a little hot with prolonged wear. Could use some air, but love the fit.
customer_reviews.author: C J

customer_reviews.title: Not a good fit al all
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot, I ordered a whole size bigger, and the room around my toes is very tight. I should have sent them back but I thought that they would stretch out. I cannot wear them long enough for them to stretch out. So they are sitting in my closet.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower0565

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: The review said the were small. They were alittle but I have a sit down job & it seems like it has stretched a bit. I always wear new balance & I actually was surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Lockard

customer_reviews.title: Can’t be more disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed!!! Bought 2 months ago. Already have tear on side of shoe. Never have I had a pair of tennis shoes tear on the side.
customer_reviews.author: buffblondie

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These tennis sneakers are extremely comfortable and require no break-in.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Sunrise

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper!
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are great. I wear them for 3 hours playing tennis, but could wear them all day. They're light, yet have good support. I do add extra arch support and have always done this.Appreciate the narrow width and the ease of ordering on line. It's almost impossible to find my 10.5 2AA size in stores. Delivery was swift, too. I'm a happy camper!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Cheap skate! Very poor quality. I work hard for my money
customer_reviews.author: Jenniffer Morris

customer_reviews.title: New Balance is a quality product.
customer_reviews.text: I wear these shoes to play tennis and also for other exercise and find them more than adequate for all activities.
customer_reviews.author: lura lenhardt

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t buy another pair
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don’t like about them they stretched out so quickly, don’t have the support she needs now !
customer_reviews.author: Debbra Kukman

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!
customer_reviews.text: I have always worn New Balance tennis shoes. These hurt my feet, specifically my toes. I thought I could break them in, but they broke my feet. Can I return them?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for aerobics
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe, especially for my Jazzercise classes. They are very supportive especially with lateral movements. They "break in" with your first wearing. I will be buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For wide shoes, they weren't very wide
customer_reviews.text: There just wasn't enough room in the toe box, though other New Balance D width shoes have fit me ok. They are cute shoes but fit kind of weird & my toes got numb in them so I had to return these shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Lokkens

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I play pickleball and it is a great court shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy K. Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable & functional
customer_reviews.text: These fit well and have a nice comfortable insert. I purchased them to play pickleball outdoors and am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: WMV

customer_reviews.title: Awesome court shoes
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE SHOES - they fit wonderfully and look great. These were on sale so even made them better. I play pickleball in them and they are great on the surface :)
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Kronenfeld

customer_reviews.title: Cushiony and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a very comfortable shoe. It fits like a glove with lots of cushion under foot to make it very comfortable yet it's still a solid, stable shoe for the courts. When I ordered my normal size for New Balance, it was too small but a half size larger fit perfectly. It's a great, comfy fit for narrow feet!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: The shoe is quite comfortable.... love them. Will probably buy another pair in a different color.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Naquin

customer_reviews.title: too small:( order a size larger!
customer_reviews.text: the shoes are very pretty in color, but did not fit my foot! order 1 full size uo from your normal size. i’m normally size 8-8.5, and i ordered a size 8.5 to be safe. the 8.5 was way to small and my foot was squished and wouldn’t fit in the shoe! my toes were hurting after wearing it for 10 seconds even! i wanted to like them but the size is too small. i think for the price you could find a better quality elsewhere, as well!
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing New Balance tennis sneakers for ,years, but NOT any more. The 1006 has absolutely no cushioning. It is terrible sneaker with no support! I think the quality has deteriorated. I suggest New Balance go back to the 786 and other better made sneakers. I have gone to Babalot instead.
customer_reviews.author: Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Beware! At least 1/2 size smaller and more narrow than the 1005.
customer_reviews.text: I saw good reviews on the tennis websites but I wish I'd seen these Amazon reviews before I bought the shoes and wore them on the court. A waste of money. I bought the same size and D (wide) width as I wore in the previous incarnation of this shoe and after wearing them two times realize there's no way I can fit into these shoes and play tennis. The padding around the ankle is overdone, too.
customer_reviews.author: Re

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: Shoe runs smaller than other NB tennis shoes. Sorry I did not return them.
customer_reviews.author: Prairie girl
